When we travelled there was a 15 minute wait, but it must be much longer at times. They only take cash (no credit cards). The view from the top is spectacular and there is a good cafe just a short walk below the upper station. We took it one way and had a spectacular walk down.
The Cable Car is a very comfortable way to reach the Mountain top and enjoy the views there. Its quick , frequent and well maintained.

The cable car is an efficient, fun way to get a cracking view of Tbilisi. It takes you up and up to the Narakala fortress, which isnt itself of too much interest but it gets you close to the Mother Georgia statue. The walk back downhill is easy.

The tramway is great for those who wants to see beautiful landscapes of Old Tbilisi, Metekhi Bridge, river Mtkvari, small houses of old city and more. Brave ones can take amazing pictures while the tramway stops for 1-2 minutes above the Surb Gevorg church. -- SUMMARY: MUST SEE

You get an awesome view of the city for a really cheap price. Also it gets you to the mountain with Mother Of Georgia statue with huge park there.

This is quite cheap for a cable car. The Carr whisks you up to the top. There are a number of gift stalls along a path. There is a staircase that leads to the fort. We did not stay long at the top. When we came down the queue was quite long and must have been stifling in
Well worth the ride up to see the view along the way and from the top. No need to take it coming down as the walk is easy and there are other sites to see along the way.

A cheap way of getting to see the best of Tbilisi. As the cable car rises above the city, you are afforded one off views of the city which can be seen in no other way. Queues were minimal, & the continuous flow of passengers result in a quick journey to the top. At the top the

This cable car, sitting 8 people, takes one from the bottom of Rikhe Park to the top of Narqila Fortress. Most people take the car up and walk down through the Old Town. The ride up provides a spectacular view of Tbilisi.

This is good. Really reasonable price. We went a little late so shops were closing at the top. Go a little earlier. Go to the top which we missed and see the gardens then take the tram down when the city is lit up.
Great fun and really reasonable! Buy a card at the bottom in the park. The views at the top are fabulous - you can then walk down through the old ruins and gardens!
I regard this cable car add doing its job, rather than as a tourist attraction in its own right Most easy way to get to the upper entrance of the Botanical Gardens amd the Fortress

It's something you "must" just do because it is worth it, although i am against "must do's". Very nice

In case you're tired and don't want to either go up/down on foot, just take it. It costs 2.50lari and not only is it fast, but you can see the entire old town from it. Worth it as a transport and touristic spot

We had seen big queues yesterday and so today walked up to the Botanic Gardens and came down on the cable car. Perfect! It is extremely good value and we could buy the necessary card at the kiosk at the top of the cable car. The views are tremendous and really worthwhile.
Just $1. Waiting in line with no shade, it got warm even in early May, careful if you do this in the summer. Do this then see then Botanical Gardens at the top.
When sunny be prepared to queue for 40 mins+. When considering actual ride is about 2 mins you could easily walk up and enjoy the narrow back streets.
It is a touristic attraction with all the pro and cons. Nice views over the city. rather long waiting time to get on

Taking the aerial tramway gets you to the top of the hill and allows you to visit mother georgia, the fortress, gardens and enjoy a coffee or beer with a view of the city! There are a lot of tour touts at the bottom but don't be put off. If you have already bought a metro card

The cable car ride was brief but very scenic. There was a 45 minute wait to get on but the people watching was good. The cost (2.5) lary is unbelievably cheap. What a great value. At the top you get up close and personal with Mother Georgia, a very imposing and impressive statue

A must do in Tbilisi. The journey is quick, but offers the most fantastic panoramic views of the river, Old Town and Bridge of Peace. At the top there's more great views, and the stunning Narikala Fortress.

This cable car connects Rike parks nearby Mtkvari river and Narikala fortress on the top of the hill at the opposite side. You can reach the fortress by food and statue of Mother of Georgia but I'd advice to use this cable car, because it gives good views on the river and is
Using the tramway to go up and walking down the old castle is an ideal and effective way to view the city and feel the city.

It is a great attraction to see the city beneath. We have taken aerial tramway to get to Botanical Garden, which entrance is just near the upper gate of the tramway. Unfortunately there is a very dangerous stairs down to Botanical Garden. My 80-years old mother in law could not

The cable car provides a lovely view of the old town The cars come quickly Easy to walk around at the top to the Santa Maria. Tip: on the downward route sit with your back to the mountain you get great pictures of the old town on the way down. I took a video and it came out

The experience is very nice, even though the line might seem very long it goes fast. The cost is very cheap 2,5 Lari thats about 1 euro. The trip is of about 2 minutes and the vie on top is very nice, even though there is no much to do on the top.

We headed to the tramway very soon after our arrival and there was little by the way of queue so we got on quickly. The tramway itself was nothing special, but the views commanded from the peak were stunning and allowed us to orient ourselves around the city,
Lovely weather, people r good helping ન easy to comnucate, love the artict, ennjyed the cable car, fresh flowers everywhere, love doing shopping,

It was by far the safest aerial tram I've ever experienced! You will see the entire view of old Tbilisi and Mskti River. On your arrival in the fortress, their staff will greet and smile, they're all lovely! It is also cheap! for 1 GEL you will enjoy such nice view!
Good view of the old city, very cheap ride to the Narikhala fort and Botanical Gardens. Worth visiting if you’re in Tbilisi for a day or two

Nice, short ride with fantastic view over the Old Town. The wait can (allegedly) be quite long during Summertime, but the breathtaking view over the whole town from the fortress above is definitely worth the wait

A must for all to see and experience this lovely city and a real treat for both adults and children. Metro card can be used for the cable car as well. Open from early morning till well after midnight. Absolutely stunning views and even if it is a bit windy, don't let that deter

Excellent and safe tram ride which takes you to the top and gives a breathtaking view of Tbilisi. On top too the view is amazing and nice. The park was not worthy and many rides weren’t available in winter. But you can travel up for the ride and view.

I'm really seriously afraid of heights, so just in case anyone else has a similar fear, I thought I'd give some info on that! It's a little bit scary towards the top as there are large windows on each side of the car and you do feel suspended in mid-air fairly high up. However
Inexpensive and convenient way to get on top of a hill with great view of Tbilisi. Suggest to walk back down through old town

As with all tourists this is a one of things to do in Tbilisi. You take it especially if u want to go to the botanical gardens which really isnt anything fancy. So take the 2 way trip instead amd skip the botanical walk
To go on top i guess is the only option to get on top.. Its cheap for return ride, and you will get perfect view from glassy cabin!

great way to take aerial photos of the old city. very fast, it takes like a minute to go up. the easiest way to go to the fortress, much better than the stairs! keep in mind that credit cars are not accepted, so you must carry some cash. it is not expensive at all.

It was very windy that day and we were not sure if it would be operational but we went anyways. We were lucky the tramway was working for few hours, after we reached up it was stopped. We went back on the stairs and it was well worth the walk

Best views of city Suitable for whole family Really good restaurants esp cafeteria Very good chox bun with custard cream, delicious. Excellent park with loads of different rides Very large park with rides spread out There is a small park where you don't have to pay but most

On a very cold day, we took the cable car up to see the incredible views. Took gorgeous photos from all angles. No lines to get on ride either way. Very. Well organized and accessible. Bonus, shopping at the top too! Kids would especially love this fun ride.

This is a quick and easy way to access the fortress at the top of the mountain. Great for photo ops on the way up. You can then walk down from the top. Allow yourself time to explore the area. On super windy days the tramway might not be running. Plan accordingly.
My family and I enjoyed the cable car ride after walking around narikala fortress and seeing the mother of Georgia statue up close. The ride was pleasant with beautiful views.
We took the Tram while walking from our hotel. There was no line, easy access a d only cost about 2 dollars to take up and back. We spent about 30 minutes at the top.

What I really like in Tbilisi in terms of transportation is you can use 1 card for Trains, Bus even cable cars! Another thing is it's good for 2 persons! We paid 2 lari/1person for a one way going to Narikala Fortress. It gives us a wonderful view and looks safe.

We bought round trip tickets for two people on the tramway and were told to keep the receipt. Good thing we did, because on the way down they tried to charge us again and we had to show the receipt. You'll admire the views on the way up, and it's only a short distance to the
Inexpensive fee for such amazing views! The whole city is at your feet! Take the tramp up and walk down. I discovered several great places by walking! Even cascade!

The Tbilisi cable car starts at Rike Park across the River Kura. You can use the official Tbilisi metro card or just buy one (not very expensive) ticket. The cabin is spacious but if there are people in it that stand around and spoil the view it is difficult to take photos.
My family and myself visited Tbilisi in Feb, 2018 and had good fun during the tip. One thing we enjoyed the most is the aerial view of Tbilisi from the Tramway.
Lovely day when I took this and you can see over the whole city.Justwalking aroud it didn't give much idea how it is pread out.

A nice way to go up the mountain to Mother Georgia monument. Could be a great tourist attraction if speed of the Tramway would be a bit lower... cuz views are nice, but you just have not enough time to enjoy those
Not a long trip up to see the fortress and the ‘Mother of Georgia’ statue. Some great views over the old and new city areas.

See on the tram was super lovely i ever seen. But on europe park, suddenly one man came and put on his bird on my shoulder and take photo not on my purpose. And the others bring more bird and put on my body even i said No. And they said "not FREE". give 20lari per bird. And i
I was here with my family we had fun and saw the city from the sky high. There are shops to buy hand made things and some cafe

A must do when visiting Tbilisi. Great views on the journey and good views when you reach the top. Very cheap you can also pay using the Tbilisi metro card which is a must for getting around using all public transport. You can buy these at any metro station and you can top them

Modern gondola and great value that takes you up to the fortress overlooking the city and the Mother of Georgia statue. Also an easy walk down to get into the historic old town in Tbilisi - a must go attraction for the city.

The cable car passes over the busy city, providing a nice view. It’s very short distance and time about 2 minutes. It will take you from down near the glass bridge to the top near to the Mother of Georgia statue. Overall nice to add to your itinerary.

This ride only lasts a couple of minutes so you don’t have time to see much. Probably would be nicer during later hours after it gets dark. Price is reasonable so in that sence why not. Especially if you are heading up to the hill anyway.

Tickets are simple to buy, at the counter , purchase ticket and card at the same time. Ride is 2 mn long approx and up the hill , you visit the statue of Mother of the Nation and maybe botanical gardens or just return by foot along the old city streets. You can also ride back!!
Great view for the money! At the time it was 2.5 GEL for person. Personal talked english there weren't any problems to get the card.
Its wonderfull to tram down , was a lovely experience travelling up by a clif chair and coming down through a beautifull veiw

The cable car to the fortress is a convenient way to get there with decent views enroute. To get back down it is better to walk, as that way you can combine a proper look at the fortress with some of the old town attractions.

Tbilisi is an interesting city, vibrant and affluent but also has a historical feel..the pano view is worth the cable ride where one will have a great view of the city, watching the daily routine or movements of the local people.
Part of the city tour this was really nice yet short up to the Narikala fortress .... good ride just keep your camera ready !!!

The walk from the city up to the top of the fortress was rewarding for the views and an excellent exercise for my legs and lung. The walk from the fortress to the cable car station and the mother of Georgia statue comparably was a leisurely walk. The cable car trip down to the
Finally, got to see it all up there in a cable car! The best feeling ever💜The city scape at night was perfect.
We used the tram as part of our wandering. It is a very interesting experience to see the city from a higher level. It is a must, in order to get the big picture ;-)
This is well worth the trip and the views from the top are superb. Bring good walking shoes as there are many steps at the top if you want to see all the views.

How could you not love to see the view from the top! No need for an expensive helicopter ride when this city can offer the same view in the cheapest possible! It was so trilling as we travel up away on the other side of the old Tbilili, the ride was so smooth and slow you wont
Pretty simple to get to ,Rike park pay 12 GEL both ways and cable carts come regularly. Didn’t wait in line and up on the mountain there are shops and a zip line on offer. Enjoy 😊

For only 2.5 GEL (one way), you can take the best aerial picture of Tbilisi. The ride is only about 3 minutes so put your camera on video mode. Don't worry if you miss some shots, just ride it again and again :)
Well worth the trip. Once at the top enjoy amazing views of the city and mountains on the horizon. Take the zipline down into the Botanic garden to finish off an amazing experience.
make it the first place to visit gives you a great view of whole city to arrange next places to visit

This is a must-do while visiting Tbislisi, as it offers a fantastic view over the whole city ! It takes only a few minutes to go to the top, and once up the hill you have have a little walk around and enjoy the view. Very reasonably priced
very nice experience to view the city from the top. i must say that this is a must do when you visit georgia.

Very impressive view while riding so i take twice (day time & night time. Highly recommend for the night while watching Narikala fortress in the charming light. Can be paid by the same card for bus or metro.
if you are in Tbilisi - take the aerial tramway for nice looks over the city and a visit to mother Georgia
It was very nice experience. Since weather was clear we could see entire city from it. City view from top is good. Nothing much to do at top other than view.
I had a ride with my family and had a wonderful view of Tbilisi from above. I recommend this activity to Tbilisi visitors.
The Ariel tramway is a must if your visiting Tbilisi, for 2 GEL it’s a short wait for the 3 minute cable car that gives you some of the most spectacular views of the city from the fortress.

Easy and fun way to see the city and go to the fortress of Tbilisi. Be smart and use your metro card instead of paying more. You can use the metro card for this ride just like any other transport in the city. The employees were confused I knew this, as a tourist. There are
The Cable ride is short, but the view is spectacular. It works from 10 am to 12 am, during this time. Do be dressed for hiking.

An adrenaline rush if you not too used to being suspended in a Tram taking in the view of Tbilisi. A definite repeat of this trip is already on our plans and the Tramway will again be a highlight for us. My sweets 🍭 and I will do this trip again

We enjoyed the short cable car ride up to the “Mother of Georgia” statue offering good views of the city and an easy walk back down via the fortress. There is no need for return tickets and the cost is only 2.50 Lari per person each way provided you have a metro card.
1st day in Georgia, we had a walk tour with ‘David’ he is from ‘Holiday Me’ it was a nice experience, as the view of Tbilisi on top is amazing.

We loved our tram ride to the top of Tbilisi! Gorgeous views from every angle of trees and stunning Tbilisi! We were four in tram ride which was very clean with sparkling windows for best views and photos! On top is a park with Ferris wheel and great view of communication tower.

I rode the cable car from the bottom to the top and it wasn’t busy had the whole car for myself which allowed me to take great pictures of the city. It seems that most of people come down with it. Definitely worth riding. Once up top you can visit the fortress and the statue of
Low cost and easy yeti visit. It opens at 10.00 and used the same card that can be used on the metro. Great views from on top. Built by the Swiss so safe to use

We descended two times by that tram. Smooth and easy ride over the river, worth doing by day or by night. Almost queues for descending, considerably big queue for ascending, trams are frequent (going around all the time) but it might still be some waiting. Price was, as far as I
Great service, impossibly low price. Worth taking a couple of times: those lights in the evening and that much detail in broad daylight. A must.
Great views of city and Mother Georgia statue. If you feel fit you can walk down via a staircase and steep cobbled road.
Great view is the first point you will notice. Great restaurant around. Tourism attractions, Bookings for all tourists trips available in this area

At last I got to get the ride on this cable car ride. You need to buy a metro card to get on this. Worth it. What a wonderful experience though it was very windy when I was on it that it stopped for a minute right ontop of the Mtsika River!
For only 2.5 Lari you are whisked from the Rike Park to the top of Narikala, traversing the Old Town in the process. Great views, and a convenient way of getting to the top!
This is an excellent way to see the city from above.You can get to Narikala and the view of the city from Narikala in the night is lovely.

What to do in Tbilisi....... aha, the aerial Tramway, not knowing what to expect, we took the ride up ( and down ), had a walk on top of the mountain, enjoyed the view over the city....... and that was it. Nothing spectacular

This was an excellent ride. Do it at night. You need to buy a 2 Lari card and each ride costs 2 Lari. The view of the city at night is great. Once on top, visit Mother Georgia and the Narikala fortress.

After a short wait in the line we hopped into the cabin of tramway.The staff were friendly and helpful. The cabin itself was modern and comfortable. After hopping out at the top, we´ve seen an amazing view of the whole Tbilise and from the other side of the hill, we saw the

obviously it is a very touristic oriented activity and thousands of them flock here daily but i would still reccomend doing it at least once for the great views and of course for many people in bad shape, its a great solution for the otherwise steep climb. you need the metro
The view from the cable car was awesome especially during the night time. However, it was tiring to wait for the turn in a long queue.
A great ride with spectacular views of the city to the Top where we visited the Mother of Georgia Statue and the Narikala Fortress. Do walk down if you like to enjoy the views longer.

I really like aerial tramways like this, so we had fun taking this one up the hill. You have to buy a ticket at the station down hill, but that's pretty straight forward. You can wait for a pivate car or join others in theirs. The ride uphill is around 5 minutes, it's pretty
This is a great way to get a view of the city and surprisingly cheap. It's also a good way to get up and visit the Botanical Gardens and other attractions on the hillside.
We really enjoyed the ride in a modern cable car up to the fort and church. It was also possible to visit the gardens. We decided to walk down and it was not difficult.

Despite being a resident of Tbilisi, this ride was my first one on this wonderful air-tram. We went up to a castle from the park below with our foreign business guests. The ride was exciting as it goes over the Mtkvari river, on top of old Tbilisi style buildings on the hillside
A short journey to the top at a very low price. Great views of the city from the cable car and at the top. If you walked up instead, it would be a VERY steep climb!
here is one more great attraction and must visit probably go in the evening time so you can enjoy day light and when you are on top see the whole city lighted and statue mother of Georgia
Absolute worth to go there...we drove by taxi upstairs and went down by the ropeway...spectacular...if you are in Tbilisi only for a short time, THIS is the thing to do....
Very cheap - 6 GEL return. The que goes very fast. At the top you get a beautiful view over the town. Do it in the evening when the town lights up.
From the centre of Tbilisi up to Mother of Georgia, it is really nice view from up, recommend to try.
Cable car runs from Rike Park up to the fortress and is inexpensive scenic way to get to the top. I recommend it
Great panoramic view of the old part of Tbilisi. You can use it during daytime and in the evening and see city lights.
It was a short ride but enjoyable with great views of the city. The cost was cheap at only a few dollars. This experience was worth doing.

The lines to the ticket counter are so long. We were queuing for almost one hour to get the ticket. Ticket price is 2 Lari one way, but you can walk back down. The cable ride will give you a chance to see the city. However is just a short ride, but you're able to take some

Vehicles also go to the top so the cable car is optional. On the top you get to see the Mother of Georgia Statue, Botanical Garden and the Narikala Fortress. The views of the city from the top are nice. The walk to St Nicholas Church is a long one. There are vendors selling

Well I was glad it was up to European safety standards. However due to only having 7 gondolas the queue was very long and made frustrating that we saw at least 1 Russian group paying off an attendant to skip the queue.

it depends if you have in your country a cable car or not, in my case , we have and it is way better than this one , in Tiblisi you need to stand under the sun for 1 hour to get a ticket , to go just for 3 mins up and that's it. i advise you to go the other way around, go up to
This tram is definitely not scary for even a person with height issues and is a really quick way to travel to the top so you can do a walk down rather than walk up.
It's just a short ride, the time waiting in line it's much longer. At least on the way down from the mountain it's better to walk.

The aerial tramway itself is a nice convenient way to get from the river straight to the top of the mountain. However, the waiting line to get on board is continuously long. With good legs you could also climb the steep path uphill in about 15-20min
The windows are dark, so taking pictures from here is not very convenient. The cabins are new and comfortable. However, I would recommend everyone to go down the mountain on foot.
I'm not used of paying 2.5GEL for something so elevating :) Cabins have tinted windows and take 6-8 passengers. Ride takes about two minutes. Lovely, worth a try.

Brief instructions appeared about purchasing tickets for this activity. Better personal relations with customers would help visitors feels more welcome. Would also recommend increased safety regulations for keeping kids in line and prevent them from pushing others. Scant safety

The whole city is visible and its really very stable. We had experienced an aerial tram in the past in a different place but this one was much better. It was a joy to watch the city from such a height.
Very modern and clean. Great way to view the city . 2 Gel a trip round trip. Night or day a very pleasant ride and view

The line for the tramway at first seems never ending, with people wantonly ignoring common decency and cutting ahead. Once you get to the ticket lady it's CASH ONLY. 2GEL for a card, 2.5GEL per person per direction, so up down is 5GEL per person. There is no good view of the

Make sure to take the tramway from the bottom first, less traffic. Buy tickets at the entrance and you have to push your way around as everyone gets over excited to get in and take pictures. The slops is impressive and the view of the city is splendid. At the top the restaurants

It only costs 5 Gel, with a metro money card. The line was a bit long when we visited in the early afternoon. But, this makes sense given the reasonable price. The ropeway is the means to visit the Narikala and the statue of the mother of Georgians. But, I think the experience
We were on a private tour and our guide insisted we take the Tram against my recommendation to walk to the top.
Go early or late to avoid lines The aerial tram gives a great view and offers the possibility to walk through the botanical garden or see mother Georgia

Despite of being crowded, the queue goes fast. Cheap I took it several times (daytime and night) the view from up there is really fabulous for greenlands and the city. From there you can go to the botanical garden and take pictures at the mother of georgia. I recommend going

The aerial tramway is a must visit sight during your visit to Georgia. The cost of it is 2.5 GEL for both ways. The card can be purshased at the site and an amount of approximtely 2 GEL is charged for the card itself. You may use the same card for all your folks and use it even
easier than climbing all the way to Narikala, and a wonderful view over the city. it's not cheap, and there's sometimes a Queue. you need to buy a card and pay for the rid up & down.

This is the typical way of reaching the botanical gardens. Though it's not only for this reason thay it should be taken. A ride at sunset is the most fascinating with the scene of Tbilisi lighting up.

This is a must do when in Tbilisi. We hopped on to the cable car from Rike Park (3 GEL one way) and it took about 3 minutes to reach Narikala Fortress. The view of Tbilisi was absolutely stunning on the way up! (Not recommended if you are afraid of heights). From the Fortress

Definitely go for amazing views. Take the tram way up (one way) and at the top there is a Zip line that you can use to get down. Highly recommend the Zip Line as once your down, you can walk through the botanical gardens, which are stunning.

The flyway is very nicely positioned which brings you to probably one of the best spots at hill top. This has remains of old historic fort structures and very nicely developed walkways. The scenic beauty is unparall. The restaurant serves you some nice drinks to sip and enjoy.

Although there as a big queue it didn't take too long to get the ticket and enter the cable car. In a sidenote, if don't yet have the money card, you'll need to get it here. The ride was good and the view great, as we got higher and further away from the city. If the weather is

You can use this aerial tramway to reach the top, where you have the Narikala fortress and ways to reach Botanical garden too. Or you can use it the other way round too. The entrance at the bottom is near the bridge of Peace. It is a short ride (price 2.5 lari one way). There
The cable way is a fast and comfortable way to travel to the Citadel, motherland statue and the botanical gardens. One wat trip is around 2,5 lari.

Large queues for a ride lasting little over a minute but stunning views of the city resulted. Unfortunately we had to walk down due to the cable cars stopping for over 20 minutes. Definitely worth a trip.
Offering panoramic views of the city, Aerial Tramway is a great place to get pictures. Be sure to carry a set of lens with your camera
Tramway was our first trip at the city. It was ok. But I don't feel safe riding on it. There was no proper lock and safety inside the tram. They said it's only for 5 persons but we're more than that.

Well worth the cheap fare, we were there at opening time 1000hrs and there were no queues, take small notes coins if you intend to pay by cash. Views are good and give you a general layout of old city. Don't worry if you miss the photo ops great views from top. If you feel up to

Well worth taking the cable car to get to the view point overlooking the spectacular gorge. Excellent views as you ascend but I would recommend walking back through the streets to get a good feel for the area.
Don't ever miss experiencing Aerial Tramway in Tbilisi! It will give you a very good bird's eye view of the city.
Tramway is a good way to explore the beauty of tbilisi. Long waiting but totally worth it.less waiting upthere.
The aerial tramway is a nice way to get down or up Narikala fortress hill. Supposedly there is a wagon with glass floor - make sure to take that one for the best views on the Old City from above!

The cable car from Rike Park to Narikala Fortress is mostly obsolete - save for the view of Old Town - with a mountain of walking to do at the top to get to whichever attraction (fortress, Mother of Georgia statue, botanical gardens) you’re aiming for. And there’s a pile of
Nice quiet retreat over the city with a sweeping view. There's even an amusement park at the top end to spend time at along with a balcony restaurant.

if you want to have a panoramic view then this is the place. it is the best way to reach mother Georgia. it has god price but short also. it is a must in Tbilisi. you can reach many things above as botanical garden and other touristic stops. there is also

Not really much to say abut this. The tramway takes you up to top of the hill where there is the statue and old fort. The view on the way up and down is good. Of L2.5 each way good value. It can be very hot up the top, and there is only on small cafe.
Amazing view, cheap ticket of tram. What a nice attraction to go up and down. The best is to try during the day and during the night. You can see different panoramic views. Its just simply FANTASTIC!

This is the only way I know of to access Narikala Fortress. The cars start running at 10:00 AM and the fee consists of 2 things: 2 or so Lari for a card and another 2 or so Lari for the ride. Once you get to the top, you keep the card and then pay another 2'ish Lari for the ride

It takes only a couple of minutes to go up to the top with this cable car. Unbeatable views of Tbilisi. The Mother of Georgia statue is there as well. It is possible to walk down and it will take you merely 10 min. well worth the 2 GEL it costs to take a ride.

The distance they carry you is short but the view of tbilisi is nice and you can go down by walking and see other attractions like Narikala. There were a zip line and a place to see botanical garden on the top , The cabins are big and comfortable.

The best time to use the cable car is every time :) My advice is to buy one way ticket during day. Use cable car to get upstairs to the walls, enjoy a view and go downstairs by foot. Visit ruins and local sulfur baths. The second time, buy back ticket (better to say credit for

You need to know that you will be waiting in a long que in order to get in tram..but it worth be waiting ....you can see tbilisi from above and will visit the Mother of tbilisi and see the statue of her closely

The Aerial Tram way starts from Tram way station in the Rike Park and ends near entrance to Botanical Garden. The travel time is about Two minutes and costs 2.5 / 3 Lari (One way). You can capture great views of old Tbilisi as you go up. From the top you can go to Cartlis Deda

Nothing special and yet very nice short ride that allows you coming fast up the hill to the Nariqala ruins/botanical garden, and at the same time enjoying the view of the city. We went up just before the sunset and it was the best time to enjoy the view. Not very expensive,

To say that it's nothing more than a short ride with good views misses the point. Both those things are correct, but it's not a criticism; the ride is very cheap and, ultimately, it seems to be aimed more at Georgians as a practical route to reach the Narikala Fortress than it

This cannot be compared with other cable cars round the world. The ride gets over in hardly a minute and there is not much to do above the hill apart from shopping. There are not many things to do in Tbilisi hence this has to be one of the standard tourist attractions.
The ride with the aerial tramway offers great views and is really cheap. The only drawback is that it is over too quickly ;-)

We did the ride while it was getting dark and it was one of the best experience in Tbilisi. The lights in the castle and other building with the reflection on the river made it look like Disneyland. Night is the best time to go on the tramway.
Lovely ride, very cheap 2.5 GEL each way (or one way) and 2 GEL for the card which can be refunded after. Nice to get the cable car up and walk down, it isn't too far.
Nice way to see the city. Ride is short but takes you over Old Town. Goes both ways or you can walk down. Very cheap.
It was really relaxing ! It was nice to see the tbilisi from above and enjoy the view !!! Just wear something casual !up there were some resturant u can enjoy
the 2 way ticket is 7 lari and the one way trip takes about 2-3 minutes . on the hill side there was no any personnel to check that the doors are closed for safety !!! that is awful really .

It is a short trip. The cable car can accommodate 8 slim people and 6 not so slim people! As it does not stop, you need to hop in and hop off fast. The view at the top is lovely. It is good to access the fortress on top in the evening to get a view before and after sunset.

The tramway starting point is in Rike Park not far from Peace Bridge and opens at 10am. This is a great way to get a fantastic view of the city. Going early helps to avoid the lines and the lighting is better for photos. The needed metro card can be bought while buying the
Best place to see the areal view of old Tbilisi. Catch the cable car in the evening and spend 2 - 3 hrs.

You must do this while in Tbilisi. There is no better view and no better way to get a quick overview of the city. It is part of their municipal transit system and thus, a fair price for a round trip. The gondola cars are clean and new and in excellent mechanic shape. Upon
Easy to access Not pricey Clean and comfy Kind staff Very nice panorama Depend on season you may wait for the queue

This is a nice ride which gives you great view to the city. I went up the hill on foot, exploring the beautiful alleys of the old town, and then bought a ticket to the Rike Park for my way back. It is a short ride (maybe 5 minutes tops), but it's cool. The price is 2 GEL for

This is my first visit of Georgia and in the first date, I decided to go to the Kartlis Deda and the Telecabin near that. One thing that I shocked was the Telecabin’s staff behavior. If they acted like thief, don’t excite. Too much rude and impolite. I’m sorry for that
the trip is not dangerous for the second time. but for the first time... if you afraid of heights. but anyway.. don.t miss it

Ok it’s a cable car, but it takes you from the top of the city , crossing the river to land you effortlessly in a modern park on the other side. You get to see the wonders of the city, the ruins, the churches, synagogues, hotels, monuments, and presidents palace and everything
If your in Tbilisi than must go to this place . Aerial Tramway is best place to Tbilisi city , River View n beautiful architecture of the city .

The view is good. Plz carry either local currency or tourist cards available at the airport. No foreign currency or credit cards accepted at this place. Plz don't get disappointed, when they don't accept credit cards or foreign currencies.
I have been here with family few days ago and the view of this place over the city is just amazing and there is lots to do.
This is how you get to the Fortress the Mosque and the Hot Spring Baths. Take an extra few minutes and walk to the falls.
The best view of Tbilisi. The carts are nice and you have a great view as you go up the hill. The cost are low(10GEL) for two people return. Can recommend it
Breathtaking viewpoint over Tbilisi old town, great view at night. Also possible to get there on foot. We got there by aerial tram, and listened to street musician singing. Very romantic atmosphere!

Went up to see the fort and statue. Great views both sides and plenty of ice cream including home made with liquid nitrogen. Also worth walking down into old Tiblisi rather than getting the cable car back to the other side of the river.
Each unit can take up to 8 people. I was lucky that in the one I took we were only 5. A beautiful and relaxing ride to the top. I chose to walk on the way down.
Tram cost was economical. I think it was 1.5 Lori (?) Each way but must buy the metro card. Great view of the city. Other than that not much more to say.
We went up the cableway after a trip down the river by boat. Trip was quick and we did not have to wait long on either of the trips. View from the top was nice but I was not overwhelmed by it.

It is well organized and looks safe. The coworkers help you friendly to get in. The view is amazing! (See photo) Wouldn't suggest for older people though, coz you have to get in and out while it's moving!

I would say that this is a must to do in Tbilisi even if you are short of time. No queues, not expansive, quick way to reach the hill with nice view, especially old city places. We have taken ride down also, to spare a time.
Get there around 10am and there will be no queue. It's 2.5 GEL for a ride and you will have to purchase one of the travel cards 2 GEL. Take a single ride up and walk down! worth it
It’s just amazing view! Better at night, but recommend to try both.. day and night to see the difference. Its just few min ride, but still amazing!
The views from this cable car are very nice. The cabins are clean and safe and the ride saves you from a very steep walk up the hill.

The ride itself is around 5 mins maximum, but well worth it for the small fee. Although I would recommend walking up to the Narikala Fortress, this mode of transport to get to the top does also give good views of Tbilisi.

This is one of the easiest ways to have a magnificent view over Old (Dzveli) Tbilisi & almost whole city skyline. Lower point to catch this Cable Car is in Rike Park, just across The Bridge of Peace or Metekhi Bridge from the heart of old town & upper located just next to

We first walked to the cable car station around 12.00 but the queues seemed to be fairly long with what seemed like a steady stream of your groups arriving. Going back at around 16.00 there were no queues at all. The fare of 2.5 GEL (each way) is good value and you need to load
The best way to go to Narikala Fortress. Breathtaking view of Tbilisi. The duration of the ride is approximately 3 minutes. Low cost.
This is a short walk from the centre of the city. The ticket was (I think) 7.60 Gel). Beware of queues from tourist buses. Return seemed quite easy and I think you can walk back down if you wish.

A cool and friendly city with very affordable prices food and beverages 24/7 taxi tour guys or girls everything available in this town the best wine bar also you can buy 3-5 lt wines with a very small money weather amazing we like it so much we recommend for everyone to visit

The tramway gives lovely views of the city on the way up to see Mother Georgia. My only complaint? Too quick!
The view is amazing, unfortunately too short in time. Tbilisi has many angles and this is one worth seeing.

It is very rare that you can find a cable car in the very center of the city, but as you can see in Tbilisi, it's possible. Everyone should try - the views are breathtaking. It's very chip - but it is very nice attraction. On the top is a castle and restaurant and souvenirs
Wonderful views of Tblisi. At the top are souvenir stands and the mother of Georgia, we strolled back through the streets of the old City.
You go up, can have a nice view from the old part of the city! Up there you can see and visit the botanic garden and the fortress!!
Excellent view from top of the hill. All big structures are very clearly view and enjoyable. Along with infant is little difficult.
Easily the best way to visit the fortress guarding the old city of tblisi. Cheap and simple to use. Would recommend

It is a short way cable car but the sightseeing is valuable experience. You can visit Narinkala and mother statue up the hills.
Everybody who is scared to walk up the easy way to the castle of Tbilisi. Nice few above the old city of Tbilisi.

This is a very organized and new Aerial Tramway, we had no problems, path is sort but we had a great view of the old city below us. Also we enjoyed the destination which is one of the tallest points of the town with view.
Every thing was good. just be careful about the people who are there and force you to take a photo with their peacocks and parrots and then take money from you
Great view of the city. Definitively is worth doing along with funicular, which gives you another opportunity to see Tbilisi from up above.

Thought while in tblisi to visit the amusement park near tv tower. To get there you need to use the aerial tramway. The park itself is almost abandoned. The rides not being used. Boredom kicked in real fast. I wouldn't visit again as it really wasnt fun and most of walking was
Use your metro card to make things easy. There’s not too much at the top except for some great views. You can walk up instead but I recommend taking the cable car up and walk down. Enjoy!
Great view of the city and an easy way to the fortress from the other side - for $1 who is not going to do this
Actually there is a little way to the destination. It takes only 5 min but it is worth trying! I loved seeing the view of Tbilisi from the top.
Nicely maintained ride.. you can reach to see Kartlis deda.. long queue for the ride.. Nice view when you reach at the top.. prefer to walk down rather than taking the ride..
Although it is a short trip, but this trip gives you a very beautiful view of the city of Tbilisi from above!

A cable train to the top of the mountain over the city was built by Belgian company over a century ago. The car is modern though. 😊 Great view over the city. Highly recommend to try Adjari khachapuri and donuts with cream at the top station restaurant. Nice park for a walk, a

This would surely be in must visit list for any duration of visit . You have to walk across Bridge of Peace , in the rike park . You need to take a MetroMoney Card(same card for Metro) for 2 GEL, One visit costs 2.5 GEL per person . You have to visit once at day where you could
Had a half day to explore from a business conference I was attending. Took this up to the Narikala Fortress. It was very cheap (I think around $5) and the views from the top are amazing.

Good way to get to Mother of Georgia monument. Nice view from top and one can shop for souvenirs on top. We walked our way back through the fort and sulphur baths. You can also zipline to botanical gardern.

We walked up from the old town ‘spa’ area to the castle and statue of Mother Georgia. The cable car was a convenient and visually pleasant way back down. It’s was 5 Lari each and you also get a travel card which can then be used and topped up for other transport in the city.

The tram is a short ride with no extra view apart from getting closer to the rooftops of the old city (beautiful). It is not worth the wait and cost. If you are fit enough for the somewhat steep 15 minute walk then that will provide you better views than the equally long line

If there is just one thing to do in Tbilisi, this would be it. Gives excellent view of the city and Old Town and saves you the trek up to Narikala fort and Mother Georgia. Can get crowded on holidays though.
Lovely view...Good service .... moneys worth!!!! Went in the afternoon......and came back at night.... Superb view!!!

Definitely worth doing while in Tbilisi. Costs 2.5 lari one way plus 2 lari for an e-card if you don't have one. Less than a 5 minute ride but great views from the top. By the time you have walked to the fortress you're half way down to the old town so it's not really worth
This is the easiest and I thin most interesting way to get to the Narikala fortress. From there I recommend to descent by foot to the sulfur bathhouses.

Suggestion to walk up to the church & statue of mother Georgia and use the cable cart coming down. Why; only few cabins being used so its a long wait for a 2 minutes ride (100+ people queuing in the off-season). Hike up is not so strenuous (20-30 min walk) and quite nice

Aerial Tramway in Tbilisi city center A good aerial view of the city center Have a camera with you It's a short visit

Ok so we waited for around 20 minutes or more to board the cable car, during which time we were hasteled to give money to beggars, and to buy dodgy perfume! There was also live music playing by 2 men with guitars! However, for the few Lari it cost, it was well worth it.

Good concept. Waited 30 min for the ride, but some street musicians played while we waited so it was not so bad. Will not do it again, the ride lasts for less that 1 min and the fortress is easily reached by walking.
A good afternoon out. Beautiful views from the top. You can see the mother of tbillisi from the top.

This is a good way to get a good view of Old Tbilisi. The travel up towards the mountain is very smooth and safe I loved the aerial view of the city. Beware of the vendors on the entrance with the animals. They charge too much for pictures.
That aerial transport is part of Tbilisi transport system. Only for 2.5 lari you can get to top of the mount. The ride takes approximately 3-4 minutes.
Very nice place with good views, safe, with a stop to the church and Pantheon! Ticket purchase a little complicated as you have to buy a card and deposit money on it but it works easily!

Was scared to ride at first however the mulled wine and chacha settled my nerves Came a couple of days latter and there was musicians at bottom a great experiance in such a great city. Beautiful honest city with many five star attractions many free or of little cost this is 2.5

That was fun,everyone should try it for once i think! On the top you can see a great view of tbilisi,but there is no other interesting thing up there

We took a night view on this tramway and it is worth seeing it, please do not miss it, we had a great time

We were lucky with the weather. Clear and sunny even if the fresh air was in a hurry! Well worth a visit with spectacular views from the car and at the top. The adjoining castle/fort was also interesting. Definitely a must when in Tbilisi
I think it’s the best way to go up the hill if you are planing to visit the National botanical garden of Georgia. A return trip costs 7 GL. The view along the way is amazing .

Ride only last a few mins but is stunning. You have to purchase a plastic credit card style pass to ride it (like londons oyster card) you then top up the card with each person's fare... The card can be given back on completion of a form and showing your passport (but seeing as
I really liked it so much. Very nice view from town. In fact very nice journey up there. You can see whole city from there. You should be there when visit Tbilisi

Absolutely loved it. Only wished it was longer. I went on 9th & 10th March, it was empty which was absolutely awesome. Day and night and both times were magical and the best way to view the city and so much to discover by just viewing the city. Don't go summer time. The queues

For 5 Lari you get a great view from the top and a ride to Nicola fortress , waterfall the botanical garden , we spent like 2 hours or more a bit there and it was really nice , pick a sunny day with good weather and it’s really the best way to see most of the city from the top ,
Enjoy this ride for the best views overlooking Tbilisi, and visit for Virgin Mary. Take some photos of the view and Narikala fortress, perfect for couples or families

Is a must in Tbilisi. The attraction is old but same time it has an amazing view while you go up. Also there is a possibility to walk amongst the nature on the top and enjoy the views also. Don’t miss a chance to visit s church there.

A great way to see Tblisi and get to highest point of city. Did tram on first full day in city and got ideas of which streets of old town would be best for walking tour.

It's integral part of city transport system. It cost 2 GEL plastic card itself and shall be loaded 5 GEL if you want only to use rope tram up and down. However to get down by foot takes 10 minutes only on quite steep downhill.
Modern and safe, not expansive, you can visit highest ground place in Tbilisi very fast with fun! in combination like town site seeing it is must visit!
This is a very handy way of getting to the top of the mountain. The old bus is absolutely awful this a great cheap and quick way to get up and down
recommended way to go to the top of tbilisi . a nice view on the way up . 12 lary for 2 adult for up and down

Great chance to look around Tbilisi from the top you can see all Tbilisi.aly time is good to go there at night or daytime +995555197776whatsapp
Really enjoyed short trip with cable car overlooking the entire city! It only takes couple of minutes, but its worth it!

The weather was cold and rainy but we got off the red bus to brave the elements and take a ride. So glad we did! What an excellent way to get a bird's eye view of the old part of Tbilisi and up to the Mother of Georgia statue. You must do this if you're visiting Tbilisi. 🌼
A pleasant ride up to where the statue of the Mother of Georgians stands a two way ride for 2 adults will cost 13 gels. Views of the city are stunning. Adults & kids alike will love the experience.

Definitely worth taking a trip up on the cable car. Very cheap, fast and exciting way to see Tbilisi. We walked back down but you can get cable car back as well if you want. Views from the top are great and it takes you to see the mama Georgia statue, botanical gardens, zip
Tblisi, Georgia...great place to for your ladies rendezvous...enjoyed everybit of Tbilisi...loved Georgian food..

We didn't use the tram to go up. Took a taxi but it was lovely up there. Living in a country with bad weather, I enjoyed the sun! Even though it was hot! Very nice people, beautiful places and beautiful nature.

It goes through one of the most beautiful landscape of buildings. The only issue which made me upset was short trip time. It would be greate if they can make it slower so visitors have more time to enjoy the view
It's a beautiful activity and you can see the city from above ! The view is fantastic ! You should definitely try it !
Great view, nice old ruins and castle of old. A bit unsafe for people going off track. But so much fun still!

It was one of the must visit and experience one should have while visiting Tbilisi as gives you beautiful visual treat from the top giving the blend of heritage and modern architecture of the city. Relative to other ropeways it is short in distance but worth it

Take the tramway to the top of the hill for great panoramic views of the city. you can pay with your transport card which is convenient.

Don't go if you are scared of heights. This is one of the tallest tramways I've rode and I gotta be honest, I was a little bit scared. Still, really well maintained, cheap and the best way to get to Kartlis Deda and the Narikala Fortress.

Beautiful view and nice atmospher. It's every time very beautiful to have a little tours in Tbilisi. Beautiful view from the higt.

Beautiful at night time. Be careful about your belongings. At that time we went there was one Egyptian family lost thier bag having all travel documents and money with a small kid. So pls careful. But the place is ok and can see mother of Georgia very near.
this place is realy amazing. u can see very very beautifull wiews of Tbilisi. it is safetly especially when u are with children.it is always clean

We went here specifically because I wanted to see ‘Mother Georgia’ Enjoyed the ride, reasonably priced, crowded but the line went quickly. The view was awesome.

Quite a beautiful landscape from the hills over the capital ! Snow far away, ancient monuments beside brand new architecture. Definitely a place to go.

Really one of the important monument in Georgia, I am absolutely content by this. Thank you very much

Great Place to hangout with friends and find the views of this incredible city from top :) so must see place/experience

Narikala ropeway is actually a cable car not a tramway and this is not a funicular. Oldest castle in the centre of the town can be reached by this cable car. Upper station has a stunning view over the old town. Easy access to the city's Botanical Garden as well as the Fortress

One has to buy a card and then load the money on it to perform a trip. After the trip it was very cumbersome to return the card and have our 2 Lari back.

The attraction of this role way is it is value for money. There are 5 tourist attraction including the freedom bridge and Mother of Georgia walkable distance from this. Would like to remind you to take pictures of the metal art bench and lock tree just outside the station.
Just loved the experience Would recommend it to everybody Do not miss it by any chance Hire a local guide to tell u more about the place
The fee is little and it's worth the ride over because of the wonderful view of the river, the cliffs & the cliff houses. I took it one-way & enjoyed the walk down after exploring the fortress.

If this is the one that goes to the fortress it was a lot of fun. Exciting and interesting things to do at the top and bottom of the tram. Worth a few trips.
Must see place at Tbilisi, especially at evening time. Up on the mountain there is a big park for walking also and big restaurant of several floors.

Takes you up to the castle. Can be a bit of a wait to get your ticket so pick your timing carefully.
Definitely a must do when in Tblisi....... travelled to the top on a warm sunny day. Really enjoyed the experience.
Short trip as it’s just few minutes but it’s good to try, ticketing was fast, cabins are in good condition & the view is really nice
Tbilisi has two good tramways to visit parts of the city and take in the views. I would recommend both. They are well priced and not expensive at all.
Ticket is very cheap, but you must also buy metro card, which you may than return back to the ticket office after finish ride. Great place after long day in the city.

You can use your Metromoney card to use the Aerial Tramway in Tbilisi. You should try that and enjoy watching the city from the cabin. But remember to use Aerial Tramway to get Narikala hill and be sure to use walking 🚶 path for return and enjoy the fantastic tourist's path.
Not too expensive, nice views, quick way to get up to the citadel and botanical garden. Or back down.

Lovely view ....Of the town below .. Summertime so long lines getting to the cable ... Take into account this factor .... Beautiful opertunity for lovely photos ..... We walked to the fort ....N the garden .. Pleasant trip ....

We took the cable cars upto the top of the Fortress.Its a nice quick journey with good views over the City and Old Town. We then strolled down the cobbled street back to Old Town.

If you're going to have tibilisi tour you must go by cabel care you can see beautiful view of city and it will be great experience in your life You can go and see fortress as well

google: it is worth full to take it because you can see almost all part of old town and you can take good pictures

Recommended place to visit. Nice view from gondola.
An affordable and convenient way to experience Tbilisi from another angle! The service was friendly and the views splendid!
It costs only 2.5 GEL and you can see a beautiful view of Tbilisi. It gets started from rike park and ends at mother of Georgia statue and botanical garden
Go for it , we enjoyed the view from on the way to the top, Easy to find and very cheap
One of things you should do in Tbilisi, great view you will see, cheap price , clean cars, you might do it at night for great sightseeing

We have enjoyed the ride to reach the mother of Georgia statue :)
You have to visit it really good experience from Georgia.
The cost is almost 3 lari for a ride.
The ride with the aerial tramway lasts less than 2 minutes but offers great view to the city and costs only 3 lari.

Fun. Great view from the top. Went during the day and loved the view. Most say the night view of the city is better. But if you want to spend time in the botanical garden (which is absolutely worth it) then better to visit around 5 pm. …

Tramway is the best option to see the Old Tbilisi with a birds eye view point. 5 lari per person you can pay by cash or you can use the tibilisi metro card as payment. Very clean and tidy. Enjoyed the ride so much.

text.wiki:
Ananuri (Georgian: ანანური) is a castle complex on the Aragvi River in Georgia, about 45 miles (72 kilometres) from Tbilisi.


== History ==
Ananuri was a castle and seat of the eristavis (Dukes) of Aragvi, a feudal dynasty which ruled the area from the 13th century. The castle was the scene of numerous battles.
In 1739, Ananuri was attacked by forces from a rival duchy, commanded by Shanshe of Ksani and was set on fire. The Aragvi clan was massacred. However, four years later, the local peasants revolted against rule by the Shanshe, killing the usurpers and inviting King Teimuraz II to rule directly over them. However, in 1746, King Teimuraz was forced to suppress another peasant uprising, with the help of King Erekle II of Kakheti. The fortress remained in use until the beginning of the 19th century. In 2007, the complex has been on the tentative list for inclusion into the UNESCO World Heritage Site program.


== Architecture ==
The fortifications consist of two castles joined by a crenellated curtain wall. The upper fortification with a large square tower, known as Sheupovari, is well preserved and is the location of the last defense of the Aragvi against the Shanshe. The lower fortification, with a round tower, is mostly in ruins.
Within the complex, amongst other buildings, are two churches. The older Church of the Virgin, which abuts a tall square tower, has the graves of some of the Dukes of Aragvi. It dates from the first half of the 17th century, and was built of brick. The interior is no longer decorated, but of interest is a stone baldaquin erected by the widow of the Duke Edishera, who died in 1674.
The larger Church of the Mother of God (Ghvtismshobeli), built in 1689 for the son of Duke Bardzim. It is a central dome style structure with richly decorated façades, including a carved north entrance and a carved grapevine cross on the south façade. It also contains the remains of a number of frescoes, most of which were destroyed by the fire in the 18th century.


== References ==
Rosen, Roger. Georgia: A Sovereign Country of the Caucasus. Odyssey Publications: Hong Kong, 1999. ISBN 962-217-748-4


== External links ==
Georgian government site
Pictures of Ananuri
UNESCO site
International Association of Tourists and Travelers
Paragliding in Ananuri


== Notes ==
